message: Usually up at 7:30-8 on a weekend, hungover or not. I used to sleep until 11 on weekends though, not sure what happened to that!
Also I find it *really* hard to stay up beyond 1am now.
If left to my own devices and sans alarm clock, I would get up at 9am and go to bed at 1am. I hate mornings. LOL.
Hmm, I think I've become a morning person because I have a view in my apartment to look at when I get up.

Today's QOTD is all about your sleep/wake patterns and whether or not you stay up until the wee hours of the morning, or do you bound out bed in the morning with a spring in your step and a whistle on your lips?
I'm definitely a night owl. I never go to bed before 2A.

I'm naturally a night owl. The instant I have no schedule, I'm up all night and sleeping all day. However, since my job doesn't work that way, I'm forced into an early-bird-type situation so that I can have some quiet time to get SOME stuff done...so I work 7-4 when at the office, and 6-3 when at home. I hate mornings, but I hate being in the office past 5:00 even more.
Also, on weekends, I get up early (7 or so) to run errands to avoid all of the people.
Early Bird but don't mind the night. Just can't stand it to be late in the office. Rather be there early and have free time in the evening.
....plus my children don't allow for sleeping in

Unfortunately I must say that I am both. I love staying up late at night reading, surfing the interwebs, playing video games, etc, etc but I also like to be up early to go to work or just to get my day started.....makes for a lot of self-inflicted poor sleep
My mood changes. I like things about both early and late schedules.
I too am an early bird: much rather wake up at 6am and go to bed at 11.
Well the kids usually wake me up at 6:30am, and I'm in bed around 11pm.
@blogkitten I know and I guess it is frowned upon if you try to sell them on craigslist...stupid! ;-)
both... regardless of what time i go to bed, i can't seem to sleep past 7:30
100% night owl. When I was unemployed and had no real obligations I'd wake up sometime in the late-morning early-afternoon and be up until around three to four am.
